alert.note: Alert for Medina; Summit (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 04 at 4:51PM EDT until September 05 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Ohio, including the following counties, Cuyahoga, Medina and Summit. * WHEN...Until 745 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 449 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible over the area through early this evening. This additional rain may result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Akron, Medina, Cuyahoga Falls, Brunswick, North Royalton, Solon, Hudson, Twinsburg, Macedonia, Broadview Heights, Aurora, Brecksville, Hinckley, Fairlawn, Northfield, Richfield, Reminderville, Boston Heights, Glenwillow and Peninsula. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
